text: XF402 is an open protocol for time-bound rights and access control on digital assets. It extends Coinbaseâ€™s x402 payment primitive into a licensing layer for NFTs, tickets, and media.
Instead of permanent, static ownership, XF402 introduces programmable access windows such as 1 hour, 1 day, or 1 week, enforced through wallet-based payment proofs.
Built for Solana's speed, cost efficiency, and agent economy. XF402 enables high-frequency micro-rentals and real-time access gating with minimal friction.
No asset custody or token wrapping. XF402 uses HTTP 402 payment semantics, verifiable receipts, and optional on-chain anchors to minimize trust without heavy infrastructure.
Access tiers, durations, pricing, and rights are defined in a standard R402 JSON schema that can be embedded inside APIs, NFT metadata, or content gateways.
Includes reference SDKs such as @xf402/r402 for JavaScript and xf402-fastapi for Python. These tools handle x402 and R402 request flows, validation, and client retries automatically.
Turn memes, art, and creative works into rentable and remixable digital licenses. Monetize culture without transferring or locking assets.
Designed for both users and agents. Enables machine-to-machine micro-payments for data, models, assets, and APIs in an autonomous computing environment.
Works with any HTTP stack including Next.js, Express, FastAPI, and Cloudflare Workers. No direct RPC access or blockchain custody logic needed to begin.
From tickets and gaming assets to premium APIs, XF402 makes digital property dynamic, rentable, and interoperable across applications and ecosystems.
Every payment produces a verifiable receipt that proves access within a defined time window. Receipts can be reused across applications and agent systems.
XF402 shifts digital ownership from static possession to permission-based usage. This enables shared access rights, usage-based economics, and collaborative value flows.
